issue.title: [Rust] Add Rustdoc header to each source file
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4245](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4245). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Each source file should contain a rustdoc header giving a summary of the contents of the file. This will make the documentation hosted on docs.rs much more useful.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4245?focusedCommentId=16747134) by Paul Kernfeld (paulkernfeld):*
I'm interested in trying to do this. Could someone take a look at [these example docs I wrote](https://github.com/apache/arrow/compare/master...paulkernfeld:arrow-4245-add-rustdoc-headers) to see if I'm going in the right direction?  If they look good, I'm happy to add more. I deliberately added a lot of examples in the docs because I find that I'm personally a lot more likely to engage with a project if it has lots of examples.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4245?focusedCommentId=16747140) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
`[~paulkernfeld]` To get better feedback, I recommend to already open a PR on GitHub and prefixing it with `WIP` (work in progress). This gives us the better review tools while everyone is aware that the work is not done yet.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4245?focusedCommentId=16747153) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
`[~paulkernfeld]` This is exactly what I had in mind :) 

I look forward to seeing the PR

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4245?focusedCommentId=16748153) by Paul Kernfeld (paulkernfeld):*
Okay, thanks for the advice! I have just created a PR, so please let me know how it looks.
